article.headline: South Alabama 68, Arkansas-Little Rock 54
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. (AP) -- Demetric Bennett scored 21 points and South Alabama used a strong second half to beat Arkansas-Little Rock 68-54 on Satuday night. The Trojans (8-11, 3-5 Sun Belt Conference) opened the game with a 21-7 lead that included a 12-2 run over a three-minute span. Terrance Akins made two 3-pointers during the run as the Trojans later took a 10-point lead at halftime. Akins led his team with 15 points. But the Jaguars (11-7, 5-2) tied the game at 44-44 with 9:29 left on a score by Ernest Little, who had 13 points. Later, South Alabama took a 57-49 lead on Stephen Cowherd's shot beyond the arc. A pair of Bennett free throws and a dunk by Brandon Davis put the game away for the Jaguars. Little and Leandro Buboltz each scored 13 points and Daon Merritt had nine assists in the win.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
